meanings.sent1: The dress was covered in frillers, making it look very fancy.
meanings.sent2: She loved to sew frillers onto her curtains to make them more beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated with frillers made of colorful icing.
meanings.sent4: Her room was like a garden, with frillers hanging from every corner.
meanings.sent5: The Christmas tree sparkled with frillers of all shapes and sizes.

meanings.definition: to add unnecessary or excessive embellishments
meanings.sent1: She always tends to frillers her stories with made-up details.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to frillers the dish with extra herbs and spices.
meanings.sent3: His speech was so full of frillers that it was hard to understand the main point.
meanings.sent4: The artist didn't want to frillers the painting too much and ruin its simplicity.
meanings.sent5: The designer chose to frillers the dress with sequins for a glamorous touch.

meanings.definition: characterized by excessive or unnecessary decorations
meanings.sent1: The frillers curtains in the room made it feel like a royal palace.
meanings.sent2: The frillers cake was almost too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent3: Her frillers style clashed with the minimalist decor of the house.
meanings.sent4: The frillers garden was a riot of colors and shapes.
meanings.sent5: The frillers outfit she wore to the party turned heads wherever she went.
